content.title: Pulse Volume Recording (PVR) and Plethysmography
content.definition: Non-invasive vascular laboratory technique that measures segmental volume changes in the limb with each cardiac cycle, providing objective assessment of arterial perfusion independent of vessel calcification.

principles.mechanism: Air-filled cuffs detect volume changes from arterial pulsation
principles.advantage: Not affected by vessel wall calcification (unlike ABI)

normal.appearance: Sharp systolic upstroke, dicrotic notch, downslope

mild_disease.appearance: Loss of dicrotic notch, rounded peak

content.statement: Pulse Volume Recording (PVR) and Plethysmography is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Diagnostics that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Pulse Volume Recording (PVR) and Plethysmography include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Pulse Volume Recording (PVR) and Plethysmography.

learning_objectives: Explain the principle of pulse volume recording
Apply PVR in calcified vessel disease
clinical_pearls: PVR is the answer when ABI is falsely elevated
Loss of dicrotic notch = first sign of disease
